definition.p: A quotient map is a surjection f:X\to Y such that V\subseteq Y is open if and only if f^\leftarrow[V]\subseteq X is open.
The topology defined in is known as the quotient topology induced by f.

Let X^* be a partition of a topological space X, and let f:X\to X^* be the surjection given by letting f(x)=A iff x\in A. Then X^* paired with the quotient topology induced by f is called a quotient space or identification space.

theorem.p: Let (X\times Y)^*=\setBuilder{\setList{x}\times Y}{x\in X} partition the product X\times Y. Then the quotient space (X\times Y)^* is homeomorphic to X.

definition.p: A subset R\subseteq X^2 is called a relation on X, where the notation xRy is equivalent to writing \tuple{x,y}\in R.
A relation \sim on X is called an equivalence relation if it satisfies the following for all x,y,z\in X.

ol.li: x\sim y and y\sim z implies y\sim z. (Transitivity)

theorem.p: Let X^* be a partition of X and define the relation \sim on X such that x\sim y if and only if \setList{x,y}\subseteq A for some A\in X^*. Then \sim is an equivalence relation.
Let \sim be an equivalence relation on X, and let [x]=\setBuilder{y\in X}{x\sim y}. Then X^*=\setBuilder{[x]}{x\in X} is a partition of X.

definition.p: Let \sim be an equivalence relation on a topological space X. Then X/\sim denotes the quotient space defined by the partition X^* given in .

proposition.p: Let R be a relation on X. Then \sim=\bigcap\setBuilder{\sim^\star\subseteq X^2}{R\subseteq\sim^\star\text{ and }\sim^\star \text{ is an equivalence relation on }X} is an equivalence relation on X.
(Therefore, an equivalence relation may be defined as the minimal equivalence relation satisfying a list of relationships.)

example.title: Curves and surfaces defined as quotients
example.p: Show that each of the following Euclidean subspaces and quotients of Euclidean subspaces are homeomorphic.

ol.li: [0,1]^2/\sim where \tuple{x,y}\sim\tuple{z,w} whenever at least one of x,y and at least one of z,w is in \setList{0,1}, and \setBuilder{\tuple{x,y,z}\in\mb R^2}{1\leq x^2+y^2+z^2=1}.

definition.p: The hypersphere of dimension n is the quotient space S^n=[0,1]^n/\sim given by \vec x\sim\vec y whenever there exist i,j\in\setList{0,\dots,n} such that \vec x(i),\vec y(j)\in\setList{0,1}.
The MÃ¶bius strip is the quotient space M=[0,1]^2/\sim given by \tuple{0,y}\sim\tuple{1,1-y}.
The torus is the quotient space T=[0,1]^2/\sim given by \tuple{0,y}\sim\tuple{1,y} and \tuple{x,0}\sim\tuple{x,1}.
The Klein bottle is the quotient space K=[0,1]^2/\sim given by \tuple{0,y}\sim\tuple{1,1-y} and \tuple{x,0}\sim\tuple{x,1}.
